text: The name of Eucken has become a familiar one in philosophical and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: religious circles. Until recent years the reading of his books was
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: confined to those possessing a knowledge of German, but of late several
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: have been translated into the English language, and now the students of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: philosophy and religion are agog with accounts of a new philosopher who
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: is at once a great ethical teacher and an optimistic prophet. There is
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: no doubt that Eucken has a great message, and those who cannot find time
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: to make a thorough study of his works should not fail to know something
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: of the man and his teachings. The aim of this volume is to give a brief
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: and clear account of his philosophical ideas, and to inspire the reader
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: to study for himself Eucken's great works.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Professor Rudolf Eucken was born in 1846, at Aurich in Frisia. He
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: attended school in his native town, and then proceeded to study at the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Universities of Goettingen and Berlin. In 1874 he was invited to the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Professorship of Philosophy at the University of Jena, and here he has
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: laboured for thirty-eight years; during this period he has been listened
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: to and admired by many of the more advanced students of philosophy of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: all countries and continents.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: His earliest writings were historical in character, and consisted mainly
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: of learned essays upon the classical and German philosophers.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Following upon these appeared valuable studies in the history of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: philosophy, which brought out, too, to some extent, Eucken's own
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: philosophical ideas.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: His latest works have been more definitely constructive. In _Life's
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Basis and Life's Ideal_, and _The Truth of Religion_, he gives
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: respectively a full account of his philosophical system, and of his
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: ideas concerning religion.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Several smaller works contain his ideas in briefer and more popular
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: form.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: As a lecturer he is charming and inspiring. He is not always easy to
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: understand; his sentences are often long, florid, and complex.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Sometimes, indeed, he is quite beyond the comprehension of his
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: students--but when they do not understand, they admire, and feel they
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: are in the presence of greatness. His writings contain many of the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: faults of his lectures. They are often laboured and obscure, diffuse and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: verbose.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: But these faults are minor in character, compared with the greatness of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: his work. There is no doubt that his is one of the noblest attempts ever
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: made to solve the great question of life. Never was a philosophy more
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: imbued with the spirit of battle against the evil and sordid, and with
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the desire to find in life the highest and greatest that can be found in
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: it.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life

text: books, various writers, translators, and friends for suggestions, and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: especially my wife, whose help in various ways has been invaluable.

text: Before we proceed to outline Eucken's philosophical position, it will be
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: well if we can first be clear as to the special problem with which he
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: concerns himself. Philosophers have at some time or other considered all
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the problems of heaven and earth to be within their province, especially
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the difficult problems for which a simple solution is impossible. Hence
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: it is, perhaps, that philosophy has been in disrepute, especially in
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: English-speaking countries, the study of the subject has been very
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: largely limited to a small class of students, and the philosopher has
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: been regarded as a dreamy, theorising, and unpractical individual.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Many people, when they hear of Eucken, will put him out of mind as an
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: ordinary member of a body of cranks. From Eucken's point of view this is
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the most unfortunate thing that can happen, for his message is not
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: directed to a limited number of advanced students of philosophy, but is
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: meant for all thinking members of the human race.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: The problem he endeavours to solve is far from being one of mere
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: theoretical interest; on the contrary it has to do with matters of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: immediate practical concern to the life of the individual and of the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: community. To ignore him will be to fail to take account of one of the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: most rousing philosophies of modern times.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: The apathy that exists in regard to the subject of philosophy is not
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: easy to explain. It is not that philosophising is only possible to the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: greatest intellects; it is indeed natural for the normal mind to do so.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: In a quiet hour, when the world with its rush and din leaves us to
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: ourselves and the universe, we begin to ask ourselves "Why" and "How,"
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: and then almost unconsciously we philosophise. Nothing is more natural
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: to the human mind than to wonder, and to wonder is to begin to
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: philosophise.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Perhaps philosophers have been largely to blame for the indifference
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: shown; their terms have often been needlessly difficult, their language
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: obscure, and their ideas abstruse. Too often, too, their abstract
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: speculations have caused them to ignore or forget the actual experience
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: of mankind.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Those who have quarrelled with philosophy for these or other reasons
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: will do well to lay their prejudices aside when they start a study of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Eucken, for though he has some of the faults of his class, he has many
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: striking and exceptional excellences.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Philosophers in general set out to solve the riddle of the universe.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: They differ in their statement of the problem, in the purpose of the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: attempt, and in their methods of attempting the solution. Some will
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: wonder how this marvellous universe ever came into existence, and will
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: consider the question of the existence of things to be the problem of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: philosophy. Others in observing the diversity of things in the universe
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: wonder what is behind it all; they seek to go beyond mere appearances,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: and to investigate the nature of that behind the appearances, which they
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: call the reality. In their attempts to solve one or both of these
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: problems, thinkers are led to marvel how it is that we get to know
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: things at all; they are tempted to investigate the possibility of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: knowledge, and are in this way side-tracked from the main problem.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Others in their investigations are struck with amazement at the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: intricate organisation of the human mind; they leave the riddle of the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: universe to study the processes of human thought, and examine as far as
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: they are able the phenomena of consciousness. Then thought itself claims
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the attention of other philosophers; they seek to find what are the laws
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: of valid thought, what rules must be followed in order that through
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: reasoning we may arrive at correct conclusions. Others become attracted
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: to an investigation of the good in the universe, and their question
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: changes from "What is?" to "What ought to be?" Others interest
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: themselves in the problem of the beautiful, and endeavour to determine
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the essence of the beautiful and of its appreciation. In this way the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: subject of philosophy separates out into a number of branches. The study
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: of the beautiful is called AEsthetics; of the good, Ethics; of the laws
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: of thought, Logic; of the mind processes, Psychology; of the possibility
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: of knowledge, the Theory of knowledge; while the deeper problems of the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: existence of things, of reality and unity in the universe, are generally
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: included under Metaphysics.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: It need hardly be pointed out that all these branches are very closely
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: related, and that a discussion of any one of them involves to some
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: extent a reference to the others. One cannot, for example, attempt to
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: solve the great question of reality without touching upon the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: possibility of knowledge, without some reference to the processes of the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: human mind, and the standards of the validity of thought, of the good,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: and of the beautiful.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: It is however essential, if one is to appreciate a philosopher, to
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: understand clearly what his main problem is. Therein lies frequently the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: differences among philosophers--that is, in the special emphasis laid on
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: one problem, and the attention to, or neglect of other aspects. To fail
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: to be clear on this matter frequently means to misunderstand a
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: philosopher.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: And it would seem that many critics have failed to appreciate the work
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: of Eucken to the extent they should, because they have expected him to
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: deal in detail with problems which it is not his intention to discuss,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: and have failed to appreciate what special problem it is that he
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: attempts to solve.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Eucken's special problem is that of the reality in the universe, of the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: unity there exists in the diversity of things. In so far as he makes
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: this his problem, he is at one with other philosophers in investigating
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: what may perhaps be considered to be the most profound problem that the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: human mind has ever conceived. The fact that distinguishes Eucken from a
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: large number of other thinkers is that he starts where they leave off.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: At a rule, philosophers begin their investigation with a consideration
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: of matter, and proceed by slow degrees to attempt to explain the reality
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: at the basis of it. Some never get further, and dispense with the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: question of human life and thought as mere aspects or manifestations of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the material world. But the problem of life is for Eucken the one
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: problem--he seeks to find the reality beneath the superficialities of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: human existence, and he has little to say concerning the world of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: matter. And, after all, it is the problem of life that urgently calls
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: for solution, for upon the solution that is accepted, the life of the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: individual is to a large extent based. It is, of course, very
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: interesting to meditate and speculate upon the material world, its
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: origin and evolution, but the question is very largely one of mere
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: theoretical interest--a kind of game or puzzle for studious minds. It is
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the question of life itself that is ultimately of practical interest to
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: every human soul. And this is the problem that Eucken would solve. Hence
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: those who expect to find a closely reasoned philosophy on matter and its
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: manifestations must look elsewhere, for Eucken has little for them.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Eucken's philosophy is a philosophy of life, and he only touches
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: incidentally those aspects of philosophy that are not immediately
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: concerned with his special problem. He refuses to be allured from the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: main problem by subsidiary investigations, and perhaps rightly so, for
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: one problem of such magnitude would seem to be enough for one human mind
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: to attempt. Eucken is a philosopher who lays foundations and deals with
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: broad outlines and principles; it must be left to his many disciples to
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: fill in any gaps that exist on this account, by attempting to solve the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: subsidiary problems with which Eucken cannot for the present concern
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: himself.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: If Eucken's problem differs fundamentally from that of most other
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: philosophers, perhaps the purpose of his investigations is still a more
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: striking characteristic. He is anxious to solve the riddle of the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: universe in order that there may be drawn from the solution an
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: inspiration which shall help the human race to concentrate its energies
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: upon the highest ideals of life. The desire to find a meaning which will
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: explain, and at the same time infuse zest and gladness into every
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: department of life has become a passion with him, and in finding that
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: meaning, his great endeavour is to prove the truth of human freedom and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: personality. He wishes to solve the riddle in order that man may become
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: a better man, the world a better world. His aim is definitely an
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: ethical aim, and his purpose a practical one of the noblest order, and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: not one of mere intellectual interest.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: There is much, too, that is original in his methods--this will become
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: evident in the chapters that follow. He begins with an inquiry into the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: solutions that have been offered. After careful investigation he finds
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: they all fail to satisfy the conditions which a solution should satisfy.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: His discussions of these theories are most illuminating, and those who
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: do not agree with his conclusions cannot fail to admire his masterly
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: treatment.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Having arrived at this conclusion, he searches the story of the past,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: studies the conditions of the present, and gazes into the maze of the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: future, and finds revealed in them all an eternal something, unaffected
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: by time, which was, is, and ever shall be--the eternal, universal,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: spiritual his, which then must be the great reality.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Upon this basis he builds a system of philosophy, which he considers to
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: be more satisfactory than the solutions already offered; with which
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: contention, there is little doubt, the majority of his readers will be
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: inclined to agree.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: After the brief statement of Eucken's special problem, of the purpose
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: and methods of his investigation, we can proceed to outline his theories
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: in greater detail, beginning in the next chapter with his discussion of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the solutions that have in the past been offered and accepted.

text: CHAPTER II
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: HAS THE PROBLEM BEEN SOLVED?
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: What is the meaning, the value, and purpose of life, and what is the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: highest and the eternal in life--the great reality? This is the question
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: that Eucken would solve. Before attempting a solution of his own, he
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: examines those that have already been offered. His discussion of these
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: theories is remarkable for the fairness, breadth of view, sympathy,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: insight, and accurate knowledge that is shown. There is no superficial
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: criticism, neither does he concern himself with the inessential details
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: of the theories.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Jest-books tell us of a defendant against whom a claim for compensation
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: was made by a complainant who alleged that the former's dog had bitten
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: him. The defence was, first, that the dog was lame, blind, and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: toothless; second, that it had died a week before; and third, that the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: defendant never possessed a dog. A sensible judge would wish to be
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: satisfied in regard to the third statement before wasting time
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: discussing the others; if it proved to be true, then the case would be
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: at an end. The defences of philosophical systems are often similar, and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the critic is tempted to waste time discussing details when he should go
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: to the root of the matter. Eucken does not fall into this error. His
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: special method is to seek the idea or ideas which lie at the root of the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: proposed solution; if these are unsatisfactory, then he does not
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: consider it necessary to discuss them further. Hence his work is free
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: from the flippant and superficial argument so common to-day; he makes a
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: fair and serious endeavour to find out the truth (if any) that is at the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: basis of the proposed solutions, and does not hesitate to give them
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: their due meed of praise even though he considers them to be ultimately
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: unsatisfactory.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Before a solution can be regarded as a satisfactory one, Eucken holds
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: that it should satisfy certain conditions. It should offer an
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: explanation for life which can be a firm basis for life, it must admit
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: of the possibility of human freedom, and must release the human being
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: from sordid motives--unless it satisfy these conditions, then it cannot
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: be accepted as final.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: The solutions of the problem of life that have been offered he considers
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: to be five--Religion and Immanental Idealism, Naturalism, Socialism and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Individualism, the first two regarding the invisible world as the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: reality in life, the others laying emphasis on man's life in the present
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: world. The reader will perhaps wonder how his choice has fallen upon
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: these systems of thought and these alone. The explanation is a simple
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: one: he considers it necessary to deal only with those theories which
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: can form, and have formed, bases for a whole system of life. Mere
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: theoretical ideas of life, especially negative ideas such as those of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: agnosticism and scepticism, do not form such a basis, but the five
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: chosen for discussion can, and have to some extent, posed as complete
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: theories of life, upon which a system of life can be built.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Has _Religion_ solved the question? If it has, then it must have done so
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: in that which must be considered its highest form--in Christianity.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Christianity has attempted the solution by placing stress upon a higher
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: invisible world, a world in sharp contrast with the mere world of sense,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: and far superior to it. It unites life to a supernatural world, and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: raises mankind above the level of the natural world. It has brought out
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: with great clearness the contrast between the higher world and the world
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: of sin, and has shown the need for a break with the evil in the world.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: It has given to man a belief in freedom, and in the necessity for a
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: complete change of heart. It has proved a source of deliverance from the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: feeling, of guilt, and a comfort in suffering. Indeed, considering all
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the facts, there seems to be no doubt that, of all the solutions
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: offered, religion has been the most powerful factor in the history of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: mankind.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Its influence would continue for the present and future, were it not
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: that doubt has been cast upon its very foundations, and had not
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: circumstances arisen to take men's minds away from thoughts of a higher
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: and invisible world, and to concentrate them to a greater extent than
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: formerly upon the world of sense. The progress of the natural sciences
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: has done much to bring about the change. Christianity made man the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: centre of the universe, for whom all things existed, but the sciences
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: have insisted upon a broader view of the universe, and have deposed man
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: from his throne, and given him a much humbler position. Then as the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: conception of law became more prominent, and scientists became more and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: more inclined to explain all things as the result of natural laws, the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: idea of a personal God in constant communion with, and supervision over
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: mankind, fell into disfavour.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: And the study of history has caused questions to be raised. Some
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: historians have endeavoured to show that the idea of an overworld is
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: merely the characteristic of a certain stage in the evolution of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: mankind, and that the ideas of religion are, after all, little more than
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the mental construction of a God upon the image of man's own self.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: History has attacked the doctrinal form of religion, and has endeavoured
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: to show that religions have been very largely coloured and influenced by
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the prevailing ideas of the time; and the question naturally arises as
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: to whether there is anything more in religion than these temporary
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: elements.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: And this is not all. In the present age the current of human activity is
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: strong. Man is beginning to accomplish things in the material world, and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: is becoming anxious to accomplish more. His railways cover the lands,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: his ships sail the seas, and his aeroplanes fly through the air. He has
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: acquired a taste for this world, a zest for the conquest and the

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: As a result of this, "Religion (in the traditional form), despite all it
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life

text: has effected, is for the man of to-day a question rather than an answer.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life

author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: In these words Eucken states his conviction that Christianity in its
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: orthodox forms cannot solve the problem of the present. This, however,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: As in the case of religion, _Immanent Idealism_ is a theory that gives
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: life an invisible basis, but the invisible has been regarded as that
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: which lies at the root of the present world, and not as a separate
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: higher world outside our own. The Divine it considers not as a personal
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: being apart from the world, but as a power existing in and permeating
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: it, that indeed which gives to the world its truth and depth. Man
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: belongs to the visible world, but inwardly he is alive to the presence
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: of a deeper reality, and his ambition must be to become himself a part
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: of this deeper whole. If by turning from his superficial life he can set
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: himself in the depths of reality, then a magnificent life, with the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: widest prospects, opens out before him. "He may win the whole of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: infinity for his own, and set himself free from the triviality of the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: merely human without losing himself in an alien world." And if he does
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: so, he is led to place greater emphasis upon the high ideals of life
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: than upon material progress. He learns to value the beautiful far above
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the merely useful; the inner life above mere existence, a genuine
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: spiritual culture above the mere perfecting of natural and social
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: conditions. There is brought into view a new and deeper life in which
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the emphasis is placed upon the good, the beautiful, and the true. In
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: this way idealism has inspired many men to put forth their energies for
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the highest aims, has lifted the individual above the narrowness of a
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: life devoted to himself alone, and has produced characters of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: exceptional beauty and strength. It claims, indeed, to be able to shape
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the world of man more satisfactorily than religion can, for it has no
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: need for doctrines of the Divine, the Divine being immediately present
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: in the world. But despite its great influence in the past, its power
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: has of late been considerably weakened.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: The question of the existence of a deeper invisible reality in the world
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: has become as problematic as the doctrines of religion.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: harmonious, and there must be a belief in the possibilities of great
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: development on the part of the human being. But a serious study of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: things reveals to us the fact that the universe is not entirely
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: reasonable and harmonious. If it were, then man's effort towards the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: ideal would be helped by the whole universe, but that is far from being
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the case; progress means fight, and difficult fight; there is definite
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: opposition to the efforts of man to raise himself. Moreover, there is
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: evil in the world, let pantheists and others say what they will. Eucken
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: refuses to close his eyes to, or to explain away, opposition, pain, and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: evil--the world is far from being wholly reasonable and harmonious, and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: idealists must acknowledge this fact. The natural sciences, too, by
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: emphasising the reign of law, tend to limit more and more the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: possibilities of the human being, ultimately robbing him of all
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: freedom--hence of all possibility of creation. And how can one be an
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: enthusiastic devotee of idealism if he is led to doubt man's power to
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: aim at, fight towards, or even choose the highest?

author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life

text: progress; the ideals of mankind tend to become external and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life

author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life

text: one.

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Then, again, there is the general indifference of mankind to lofty aims;
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life

text: material world.

text: Nature in the early ages had been superficially explained, often in the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: light of religious doctrine. Man gave to nature a variety of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: explanations and of colouring, depending largely upon his ideas of the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: place of nature in relation to himself and to the invisible world. But
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: such anthropomorphic explanations could not long survive the progress of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the sciences, for a scientific comprehension of nature could only be
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life

text: then investigated nature more and more as an object apart from himself.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: reality of nature as something independent, and to increase on a very
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: large scale his knowledge of, and control over nature. When man began to
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: formulate and understand nature, he began, too, to invent machines to
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: profit from the knowledge he gained. Hence followed a marvellously
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the sciences was very great, for he had come to appreciate more than
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: before the superiority of the human soul over the material world. Hence
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life

text: rendering less necessary the conception of a spiritual world. The
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life

author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: to the desired end. Hence it comes about that only one standard of value
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: remains, that of usefulness, for that alone can be regarded as valuable
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: which proves to be useful towards the preservation and enjoyment of the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: natural life. The ideas of the good, the beautiful, and the true, lose
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the glory of their original meaning, and become comparatively barren
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: conceptions. Hence at a stroke the spiritual world is wiped away, the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: soul of man is degraded from its high position, the great truths of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: religion are cast aside as mere illusions.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: The naturalistic explanation possesses the apparent advantage of being a
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: very simple one, and hence attracts the human mind with great force in
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the early stages of mental culture. All the difficulties of the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: conception of a higher world are absent, for the naturalistic position
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: does not admit of its existence. It gives, too, some purpose to life,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: even though that purpose is not an ideal one.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Eucken is not reluctant to give the theory all the credit it deserves,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: and he is prepared to admit that it fulfils to some extent the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: conditions which he holds a satisfactory solution should fulfil.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: He goes, however, immediately to the root of the matter, and finds that
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the very existence of the theory of naturalism in itself is an eloquent
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: disproof of the theory. The existence of a comprehensive scientific
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: conception involves an activity which is far superior to nature itself,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: for it can make nature the object of systematic study. An intellect
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: which is nothing more than a mirror of sense impressions can get little
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: beyond such sense impressions, whereas the highly developed scientific
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: conception of nature that obtains to-day is far beyond a mere collection
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: of sense impressions. Nature, indeed, is subdued and mastered by man;
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: why then degrade man to the level of a universe he has mastered? To
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: produce from the phenomena of nature a scientific conception of nature
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: demands the activity of an independent, originative power of thought,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: which, though it may be conditioned by, and must be related to, sense
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: impressions, is far above mere sense impressions.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Naturalism, in directing attention to the things that are experienced,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: fails to take proper account of the mind that experiences them; it
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: postulates nature without mind, when only by the mind processes can man
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: become aware of nature, and construct a naturalistic scheme of life. "To
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: a thorough-going naturalism, naturalism itself is logically impossible."
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Hence the impossibility of the naturalistic theory as an explanation of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: life.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Then it fails to provide a high ideal for life, and to release man from
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: sordid motives. It gives no place for love, for work for its own sake,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: for altruistic conduct, or for devotion to the high ideals of life. The
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: aim of life is limited to this world--man has but to aim at the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: enjoyment and preservation of his own life. The mechanical explanation
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: of life, too, does away with the possibility of human freedom and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: personality, and it is futile to urge man to greater efforts when
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: success is impossible. It is a theory which does justice merely to a
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: life of pleasure and pain, its psychology has no soul, and its political
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: economy bases the community upon selfishness.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: In this way Eucken disproves the claim of naturalism; in doing so he
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: points out that a satisfactory solution must take account of the life of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: nature in a way which religion and idealism have failed to do.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Of late years _Socialism_ and _Individualism_ have come into prominence
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: as theories of life. Eucken attributes the movements in the first
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: instance to the receding into the background of the idea of an overworld
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: which gave meaning and value to life. When doubt was thrown upon
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: religion and idealism, when confidence in another world was shaken, man
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: lost to an extent his moral support. Where could he turn now for a firm
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: basis to life? He might, of course, turn from the invisible world to the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: world of sense, to nature. But the first result of this is to make man
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: realise that he is separate from nature, and again he fails to find
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: support. He is an alien in the world of nature, and disbelieves the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: existence of a higher world. When both are denied him he turns naturally
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: to his fellow-men--here at least he can find community of interest--here
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: at least he is among beings of his own type. Hence he confines his
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: attention to the life of humanity, and in this, the universe of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: mankind, he hopes to find an explanation of his own life, and a value
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: for it.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: The progress of humanity, then, must become the aim of life--all our
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: strength and effort must be focussed upon human nature itself. But an
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: immediate difficulty arises. Where are we to find Man? "Is it in the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: social community where individual forces are firmly welded together to
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: form a common life, or among individuals as they exist for themselves in
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: all their exhaustless diversity?" If we put the community first, then
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the social whole must be firmly rooted in itself and be independent of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the caprice of its members. The duty of the individual is to subordinate
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: himself to the community--this means socialism. If, on the other hand,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the great aim is to develop the individual and to give him the maximum
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: of opportunity to unfold his special characteristics, we arrive at an
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: opposing theory--that of individualism.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: In the history of society we find an age of socialistic ideas followed
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: by one of individualistic ideas, and vice versa, and there is much that
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: is valuable in each, in that it tends to modify and disprove the other's
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: extreme position.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: The present wave in the direction of _socialism_ arises, to an extent,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: in reaction from the extremely individualistic position of previous
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: ages. Man is now realising that the social relations of life are of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: importance as well as the character of his own life. He realises the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: interdependence of members of a community, and the conception of the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: State as a whole, a unit, instead of a mere sum of individuals, grows
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: up. The modern industrial development and the organisation of labour
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: have, too, emphasised the fact that the value of the individual depends
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: largely upon his being a part of society. His work must be in
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: co-operation with the work of others to produce the best effect; for in
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: such co-operation it produces effects which reach far beyond his own
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: individual capacity. Hence his life appears to receive value from the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: social relations, and the social ideal is conceived. The development of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the individual no longer becomes the aim but rather the development of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the community. In setting out the development of society as his aim, the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: individual makes considerable sacrifices. All that is distinctly
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: individual must go, in character, in work, in science, and art, and that
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: which is concerned with the common need of society must receive
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: attention. This means undoubtedly a limitation of the life of the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: individual, and often entails a considerable sacrifice; but the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: sacrifice is made because of the underlying belief that in the sum of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: individual judgments there is reason, and that in the opinion of the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: majority there is truth. This socialistic culture finds in the present
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: condition of society, plenty of problems to hand, and in its treatment
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: of these problems a vigorous socialistic type of life is developed. The
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: most pressing problem is concerned with the distribution of material and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: spiritual goods. Material goods and the opportunity for spiritual
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: culture that go with them have been largely a monopoly of the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: aristocracy. Now arises a demand for a more equal distribution, and this
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: is felt to be a right demand, not only from the point of view of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: justice, but also for the sake of spiritual culture itself. So it is
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: that the movement for the social amelioration of the masses starts. The
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: welfare of humanity is its aim, and all things, religion, science, and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: art, must work towards this end, and are only of value in so far as they
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: contribute towards it.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Now it is a fundamental principle of a logical socialistic system that
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: truth must be found in the opinions of the masses, and the average
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: opinion of mankind must be the final arbiter of good and evil. The
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: tendency of the masses as such is to consider material advancement the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: most cherished good. Hence, inevitably, a thorough-going socialism must
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: become materialistic, even though at an earlier stage it was actuated by
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the desire for opportunities of spiritual culture.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: A genuinely socialistic culture, too, makes the individual of value only
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: as a member of society. This, Eucken affirms, is only true in the most
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: primitive societies. As civilisation progresses, man becomes conscious
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: of himself, and an inner life, which in its interests is independent of,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: and often opposed to society, develops. His own thought becomes
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: important to man, and as his life deepens, religion, science, art, work
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: &c., become more and more a personal matter.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: All such deepening of culture, and of creative spiritual activity, is a
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: personal matter. From this deepening and enriching of the inner life of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the individual proceeds creative spiritual activity, which attempts
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: spiritual tasks as an end in themselves, and which gradually builds up a
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: kingdom of truth and spiritual interest which immeasurably transcends
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: mere human standards. All these are historical facts of experience; the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: socialistic system finds no place and no explanation for them, and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: consequently it cannot be regarded as a sufficiently comprehensive
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: explanation of the problem. To a man who has once realised these
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: individual experiences, the merely human, socialistic system becomes
