text: THE PERSONAL AND THE UNIVERSAL
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: In the last chapter the ascent of the human being from serfdom to
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: freedom and personality was traced. In doing so it was necessary to make
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: frequent reference to the Universal Spiritual Life.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: When we turn to consider the characteristics of the Universal Spiritual
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Life, many problems present themselves. How can we reconcile freedom and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: personality with the existence of an Absolute? What is the nature of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: this Absolute, and in what way is the human related to it? What place
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: should religion play in the life of the spiritual personality? These
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: are, of course, some of the greatest and most difficult problems that
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: ever perplexed the mind of man, and we can only deal briefly with
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Eucken's contribution to their solution.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Can a man choose the highest? This is the form in which Eucken would
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: state the problem of freedom. His answer, as already seen, is an
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: affirmative one. The personality chooses the spiritual life, and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: continually reaffirms the decision. This being so, it is now no longer
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: possible to consider the human and the divine to be entirely in
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: opposition. And the more the spiritual personality develops, so much the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: less does the opposition obtain, until a state of spirituality is
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: arrived at when all opposition of will ceases--then we attain perfect
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: freedom. "We are most free, when we are most deeply pledged--pledged
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: irrevocably to the spiritual presence, with which our own being is so
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: radically and so finally implicated." Thus freedom is obtained in a
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: sense through self-surrender, but it is through this same self-surrender
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: that we realise spiritual absoluteness. Hence it is that perfect freedom
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: carries with it the strongest consciousness of dependence, and human
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: freedom is only made possible through the absoluteness of the spiritual
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: life in whom it finds its being.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: English philosophers have dealt at length with the question of the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: possibility of reconciling the independence of personality and the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: existence of an Absolute. From Eucken's point of view the difficulty is
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: not so serious. When he speaks of personality he does not mean the mere
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: subjective individual in all his selfishness. Eucken has no sympathy
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: with the emphasis that is often placed on the individual in the low
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: subjective sense, and is averse from the glorification of the individual
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: of which some writers are fond. Indeed, he would prefer a naturalistic
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: explanation of man rather than one framed as a result of man's
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: individualistic egoism. The former explanation admits that man is
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: entirely a thing of nature; the latter, from a selfish and proud
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: standpoint, claims for man a place in a higher world. There is nothing
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: that is worthy and high in the low desires of Mr. Smith--the mere
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: subjective Mr. Smith. But if through the mind and body of Mr. Smith the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Absolute Spirit is realising itself in personality--then there is
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: something of eternal worth--there is spiritual personality. There will
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: be opposition between the sordidness of the mere individual will and the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: divine will, but that is because the spiritual life has not been gained.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: When the highest state of spiritual personality has been reached, then
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: man is an expression--a personal realisation of the Absolute, is in
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: entire accord with the absolute, indeed becomes himself divine.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: This does not rob the term personality of its meaning, for each
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: personality does, in some way, after all, exist for itself. Each
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: individual consciousness has a sanctity of its own. But the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: being-for-self develops more and more by coming into direct contact with
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the Universal Spiritual Life.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Here, then, we arrive at something that appears to be a paradox. We have
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the phenomenon of a being that is free and existing for itself, yet in
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: some way dependent upon an absolute spiritual life. We have, too, the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: phenomenon of a human being becoming divine. How is it really possible
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: that self-activity can arise out of dependence? Eucken does not attempt
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: to explain, but contends that an explanation cannot be arrived at
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: through reasoning. We are forced to the conclusion, we realise through
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: our life and action that this is the real state of affairs, and in this
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: case the reality proves the possibility. "This primal phenomenon," he
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: says, "overflows all explanation. It has, as the fundamental condition
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: of all spiritual life, a universal axiomatic character." Again he says,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: "The wonder of wonders is the human made divine, through God's superior
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: power." "The problem surpasses the capacity of the human reason." For
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: taking up this position, Eucken is sharply criticised by some writers.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: When we approach the problem of the nature of the Absolute in itself,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the main difficulty that arises is whether God is a personal being. God,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: says Eucken, is "an Absolute Spiritual Life in all its grandeur, above
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: all the limitations of man and the world of experience--a Spiritual Life
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: that has attained to a complete subsistence in itself, and at the same
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: time to an encompassing of all reality." The divine is for Eucken the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: ultimate spirituality that inspires the work of all spiritual
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: personalities. When in our life of fight and action we need inspiration,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: we find "in the very depths of our own nature a reawakening, which is
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: not a mere product of our activity, but a salvation straight from God."
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: God, then, is the ultimate spirituality which inspires the struggling
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: personality, and gives to it a sense of unity and confidence. Eucken
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: does not admit that God is a personality in the sense that we are, and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: deprecates all anthropomorphic conceptions of God as a personal being.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Indeed, to avoid the tendency to such conceptions he would prefer the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: term "Godhead" to "God." Further considerations of the nature of God can
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: only lead to intellectual speculations. For an activistic philosophy,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: such as Eucken's philosophy is, it would seem sufficient for life and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: action to know that all attempts at the ideal in life, originate in, and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: are inspired by, the Absolute Spiritual Life, that is by God.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: We cannot discuss fully the relation of human and divine without, too,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: dealing with the ever urgent problem of religion. This is a problem in
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: which Eucken is deeply interested, and concerning which he has written
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: one of his greatest works--_The Truth of Religion_--a work that has been
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: described as one of the greatest apologies for religion ever written.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: What is religion? Most people perhaps would apply the term to a system
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: of belief concerning the Eternal, usually resting upon a historical or
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: traditional basis. Others would include in the term the reverence felt
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: for the Absolute by the contemplative mind, even though that mind did
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: not believe in any of the traditional systems. Some would emphasise the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: fact that religion should concern itself with the establishment of a
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: relationship between the human and the Divine.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: But Eucken does not find religion to consist in belief, nor in a mere
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: attitude towards the mysteries of an overworld. In keeping with the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: activistic tone of his whole philosophy he finds religion to be rooted
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: in life, and would define religion as an action by which the human being
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: appropriates the spiritual life.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: The first great concern of religion must be the conservation--not of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: man, as mere man, but of the spiritual life in the human being, and it
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: means "a mighty concentration of the spiritual life in man." The
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: essential basis that makes religion possible is the presence of a Divine
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: life in man--"it unfolds itself through the seizure of this life as
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: one's own nature." Religion must be a form of activity, which brings
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: about the concentration of the spiritual life in the human soul, and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: sets forth this spiritual life as a shield against unworthy elements
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: that attempt to enter and to govern man.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: The essential characteristic of religion must be the demand for a new
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: world. "Religion is not a communication of overworld secrets, but the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: inauguration of an overworld life." Religion must depend upon the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: contradiction and opposition that exists in human life, and upon the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: clear recognition of the distinction between the "high" and the "low" in
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: life. It must point to a means of attaining freedom and redemption from
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the old world of sin and sense, and to the possibility of being elevated
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: into a new and higher world. It must, too, fight against the extremes of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: optimism and pessimism, for while it will acknowledge the presence of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: wrong, it will call attention to the possibility of deliverance. It must
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: bring about a change of life, without denying the dark side of life; it
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: must show "the Divine in the things nearest at hand, without idealising
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: falsely the ordinary situation of life."
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: The great practical effect of religion, then, must be to create a demand
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: for a new and higher world in opposition to the world of nature. For
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: this new life religion must provide an ultimate standard. "Religion must
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: at all times assert its right to prove and to winnow, for it is
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: religion--the power which draws upon the deepest source of life--which
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: takes to itself the whole of man, and offers a fixed standard for all
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: his undertakings." Religion must provide a standard for the whole of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: life, for it places all human life "under the eternity." It is not the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: function of religion to set up a special province over against the other
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: aspects of his life--it must transform life in its entirety, and affect
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: all the subsidiary aspects.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: But religion is not gained, any more than human freedom, once for all
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: time--it must be gained continually afresh, and sought ever anew. Thus
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the fact of religion becomes a perpetual task, and leads to the highest
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: activity.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Eucken speaks of two types of religion--Universal and Characteristic
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Religion. The line of division between them is not easy to draw, but the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: distinction gives an opportunity for emphasising again the essential
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: elements of true religion.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: _Universal Religion_ is a more or less vague appreciation of the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Spiritual, which results in a diffused, indefinite spiritual life. The
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: personality has appreciated to some extent the opposition between the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: natural and the spiritual, and has chosen the spiritual. He adopts a new
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: attitude or mood, towards the world in consequence, and that is an
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: attitude of fight against the world of nature. But everything is vague;
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the individual has not yet appreciated the spiritual world as his own,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: and feels that he is a stranger in the higher world, rather than an
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: ordinary fully privileged citizen. He has not yet associated himself
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: closely enough with the Universal Spirit, everything is superficial,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: there is hunger and thirst for the higher things in life, but these have
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: not yet been satiated.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Some people never get beyond this vague appreciation of the spiritual
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: until perhaps some great trial or temptation, a long illness or sad
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: bereavement falls to their lot. Then they feel the need for a religion
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: that is more satisfying than the Universal Religion with which they have
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: in the past been content. They want to get nearer to God; they feel the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: need of a personal God who is interested in their trials and troubles.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: They are no longer satisfied with the conception of a God that is far
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: away, they thirst for His presence. This feeling leads the individual to
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: search for a more definite form of religion, in which the God is
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: regarded as supremely real, and reigns on the throne of love. The
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: personality enters into the greater depths of religion, and it becomes a
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: much more real and powerful influence in his life. He has no longer a
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: mere indefinite conception of a Deity, but he thinks of God as real and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: personal. Instead of adopting a changed attitude towards the world of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: nature, he comes to demand a new world. He is now a denizen of the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: spiritual world, and there results "a life of pure inwardness," which
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: draws its power and inspiration from the infinite resources of the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Universal Spiritual Life in which he finds his being. This type of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: religion Eucken calls _Characteristic Religion_.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: The historical religions would seem to represent, to some extent, the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: attempts of humankind to arrive at a religion of this kind. A further
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: distinction arises between the historical forms of religion, of which
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: one at most, if any, can express the final truth, and the Absolute form
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: of religion, which if not yet conceived, must ultimately express the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: truth in the matter of religion.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Eucken is never more brilliant than he is in the examination he makes of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the historical forms of religion, for the purpose of formulating the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Absolute and final form; some account of this must be given in the next
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: chapter.

author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)
