text: We have attempted to enunciate the special problem with which Eucken
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: deals, and to follow him in his masterly criticisms of the solutions
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: that have been offered, in his further search for the reality in life,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: in his arguments and statement of the philosophy of the spiritual life,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: and finally in his profound and able investigation into the eternal
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: truth that is to be found in religion. In doing so, we have only been
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: able in a few cases to suggest points of criticism, and sometimes to
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: emphasise the special merits of the work. It was necessary to choose
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: between making a critical examination of a few points, and setting forth
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: in outline his philosophy as a whole. It was felt that it would be more
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: profitable for the average reader if the latter course were adopted.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Thousands who have heard the name of Eucken and have read frequent
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: references to him are asking, "What has Eucken really to say?" and we
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: have attempted to give a systematic, if brief, answer to the question.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Having done this it will be well to mention some of the main points of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: criticism that have been made, and to call attention again to some of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the remarkable aspects of the contributions he has made to philosophy
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: and religion.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Several critics complain of the obscurity of his writings, of his loose
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: use of terms, and of his tendency to use freely such indefinite and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: abstruse terms as "The Whole," "The All," &c., and of his tendency to
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: repeat himself. Of course, if he is guilty of these faults, and he
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: certainly is to some extent, they are merely faults of style, and do not
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: necessarily affect the truth or otherwise of his opinions. In the matter
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: of clarity he is very variable; occasional sentences are brilliantly
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: clear, others present considerable difficulty to the practised student.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: His more popular works, however, are much clearer and easier to
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: understand than the two standard treatises on _The Truth of Religion_
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: and _Life's Basis and Life's Ideal_. His tendency to repetition is by no
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: means an unmixed evil, for even when he appears to be repeating himself,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: he is very often in reality expressing new shades of meaning, which help
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: towards the better understanding of the first statements.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: The slight looseness in the use of terms, and a certain inexactness of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: expression that is sometimes apparent, must of course not be
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: exaggerated; it is by no means serious enough to invalidate his main
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: argument. It gives an opportunity for a great deal of superficial
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: criticism on the part of unsympathetic writers, which, however, can do
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: little harm to Eucken's position. One has to remember that it is
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: difficult to combine the fervour of a prophet with pedantic exactness,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: and that an inspired and profound philosopher cannot be expected to
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: spend much time over verbal niceties.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Of course one would prefer absolute clarity and exactness, but we must
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: guard against allowing the absence of these things to prejudice us
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: against the profound truths of a philosophical position, which are not
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: vitally affected by that absence.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Frequent criticism is directed towards the incompleteness of Eucken's
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: philosophy. He does not introduce his philosophy with a systematic
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: discussion of the great epistemological and ontological problems.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Philosophers have often introduced their work in this way, and it has
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: been customary to expect an introduction of the kind. To do so, however,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: would be quite out of keeping with Eucken's activistic position, as it
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: would necessarily involve much intellectual speculation, and he does not
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: believe that the problem of life can be solved by such speculation. It
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: is unfortunate that he has so little to say concerning the world of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: matter. Beyond insisting upon the superiority of the spiritual life,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: which he calls the "substantial," over matter, which he calls the merely
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: "existential," he tells us very little about the material world. Rightly
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: or wrongly, thinkers are deeply interested in the merely existential, in
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the periphery of life, in the material world, but for the solution of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: this problem Eucken contributes little or nothing. His sole concern is
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the spiritual world, and although we should like an elaboration of his
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: views on the mere periphery of life, we must not let the fact that he
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: does not give it, lead us to undervalue his real contributions. Another
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: serious incompleteness lies in the fact that he pays little attention to
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the psychological implications of his theories. Until he does this, his
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: philosophy cannot be regarded as complete. Eucken, however, would be the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: last to claim that his solution is a finished or final one; he is
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: content if his work is a substantial contribution to the final solution.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Objection has been taken to the fact that he starts upon his task with a
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: definite bias in a certain direction. He candidly admits from the outset
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: that his aim is to find a meaning for life, and in doing this he of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: course tacitly assumes that life has a deep and profound meaning. Strict
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: scientists aver that the investigator must set out without prejudice, to
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: examine the phenomena he observes; and Eucken's initial bias may form a
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: fatal stumbling-block to the acceptance of his philosophy by these, or
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: indeed, by any who are not disposed to accept this fundamental position.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: If we deny that life has a meaning, then Eucken has little for us; but
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: if we are merely doubtful on the matter, the reading of Eucken will
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: probably bring conviction.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Many critics point to the far-reaching assumptions he makes. He assumes
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: as axiomatic certainties and insoluble mysteries the existence of the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: spiritual life in man, the union of the human and divine, and the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: freedom of the spiritual personalities, though in a sense dependent upon
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the Universal Spiritual Life. This of course does not mean that he is in
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the habit of making unjustifiable assumptions. This is far from being
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the case; on the contrary, he takes the greatest care in the matter of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: his speculative bases. There are some fundamental facts of life,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: however, which according to Eucken are proved to us by life itself; we
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: feel they must be true, but they are not truths that can be reasoned
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: about, nor proved by the intellect alone. These are the three great
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: facts mentioned above, which, while not admitting of proof, must be
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: regarded as certainties.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: His contention that they cannot be reasoned about has led to the further
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: charge of irrationalism. The question that has to be decided is, whether
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Eucken in emphasising the fact that great truths must be solved by life
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: and action, is underestimating the part that intellect must play in
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: life. The decision must be largely one of individual opinion. Many
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: critics are of the opinion that he does lay too little stress upon the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: intellectual factor in life. In actual fact, however, the fault is more
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: apparent than real, for Eucken does in fact reason and argue closely
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: concerning the facts of life. The charge, too, is to some extent due to
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the fact that he continually attacks the over-emphasis on the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: intellectual that the people of his own race--the Germans--are apt to
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: place. With the glorification of the intellect he has no sympathy, for
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: he feels there is something higher and more valuable in life than
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: thought--and that is action.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: These are the main points of criticism that have been raised--the reader
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: must judge for himself how seriously they should be regarded. But before
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: arriving at a final opinion he must think again of the contributions
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Eucken has indubitably made to philosophy and religion, of which we
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: shall again in brief remind him.

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: He has given us a striking examination of the various theories of life,
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: and has ably demonstrated their inadequacy. He has displayed great
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: scholarship in his search for the ultimate reality. He has found this
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: reality in the universal life, and has urged the need for a break with
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the natural world in order to enter upon a higher life. He has traced
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: the progress of the spiritual life, and has given us ultimately a bold
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: vindication of human personality and of the freedom of the spiritual
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: being.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: He has raised philosophy from being mere discussions concerning abstract
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: theories to a discussion of life itself. In this way philosophy becomes
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: not merely a theory concerning the universe, nor merely a theory of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: life, but a real factor in life itself--indeed it becomes itself a life.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Thus has he given to philosophy a higher ideal, a new urgency--by his
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: continued emphasis upon the spiritual he has given to philosophy a
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: nobler and a higher mission. He has placed the emphasis in general upon
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: life, and has pointed out the inability of the intellect to solve all
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: life's problems. He has given to idealistic philosophies a possible
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: rallying-point, where theories differing in detail can meet on common
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: ground. As one eminent writer says: "The depth and inclusiveness of
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: Eucken's philosophy, the comprehensiveness of its substructure and its
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: stimulating personal quality, mark it out as the right rallying-point
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: for the idealistic endeavour of to-day."
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: And what does he give to religion? Many will reply that he has given us
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: nothing that is not already in the Christian religion. Therein lies the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: value and strength of Eucken's contributions. He has given a striking
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: vindication of the spiritual content of Christianity as against the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: effects of time changes. He has attempted to bring out the contrast
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: between what is really vital, and what are merely temporary colourings
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: and accretions. He makes many of the main elements of Christianity
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: acceptable without the need of a historical basis or proof. Not only
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: does he present the Christian position as a reasonable view of the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: problem of life, but as the only solution that can really solve the
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: final problem. He has cleared the decks of all superfluous baggage, and
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: has laid bare a firm basis for a practical, constructive endeavour.
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: He has given us in himself a profound believer in the inward and higher
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: nature of man, and in the existence of the spiritual life. As one critic
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: says: "The earnestness, depth and grandeur, humility and conscious
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: choice of high ideals, have raised his work far above mere intellectual
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: acuteness and minuteness."
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: In Eucken we have one of the greatest thinkers of the age--some would
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: say _the_ greatest--setting his life upon emphasising the spiritual at a
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: time when the tendency is strongly in materialistic directions. He has
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: gathered around him a number of able and whole-hearted disciples in
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: various countries, and future ages may find in Eucken the greatest
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: force in the revulsion of the twentieth century (that is already making
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: itself felt) from the extreme materialistic position, to take religion
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: up again, and particularly the Christian religion, as the only
title: Rudolph Eucken : a philosophy of life
author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)

text: satisfying solution of humanity's most urgent problem.

author: Jones, Abel J. (Abel John)
